abstract: United States Chemical Safety Board releases final report on 2013 explosion at fertilizer plant in West, Texas, finding almost 20 fertilizer plants in state and others across nation are similarly situated dangerously close to schools, parks, residential areas and nursing homes; report says close proximity led to widespread damage and deaths following explosion.
lead_paragraph: Nearly 20 fertilizer plants in Texas and others nationwide have the same dangerous proximity to schools, parks and housing as the one that exploded in a Central Texas town, the federal report says.

headline.main: Many Fertilizer Plants Are Poorly Located and Regulated, Says Report on 2013 Blast
headline.print_headline: Many Fertilizer Plants Are Poorly Located and Regulated, Says Report on 2013 Blast

snippet: Nearly 20 fertilizer plants in Texas and others nationwide have the same dangerous proximity to schools, parks and housing as the one that exploded in a Central Texas town, the federal report says.

keywords.value: Chemical Safety and Hazard Investigation Board
